attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: We want the UK to appoint a dedicated minister for young people.
attributes.background: Young people in this country, are not being heard, and not being catered for by government. We constantly get shafted at the expense of the silver haired vote because of the perception that we aren't engaged with, or care about politics. We do care! We want somebody accountable to deal with us.
attributes.additional_details:
Ever since the 2008 recession, young people have been beaten down with a stick and told to put up.

The abolishing of EMA allowance
Trebling university fees
Taking away housing benefit for 18-21 year old's
New living wage excluding  under  25's

Are all examples of government policy designed to take away from young people in order to give to other demographics of the vote.

All in the age of low wages and astronomical rent and house prices. 
It's time we engage and let our voice be heard.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action: Change the law on eligibility to stand for elected local government posts
attributes.background: Make it unlawful to hold 2 elected posts within local government simultaneously. Make it unlawful for 2 members of the same household (eg spouses) to hold simultaneous posts within the same County council or District within that county.
attributes.additional_details: Recent elections for Police and Crime Commissioner in Warwickshire resulted in the candidate elected being the spouse of the Leader of Warwickshire County Council. The leader of Stratford upon Avon District council also holds a position on Warwickshire County Council. Other councillors hold positions on both District and County Councils. It is hard to envisage how these dual roles and close relationships can not lead to undemocratic influences, whether knowingly or unwittingly.

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: Change the law so that cowboy trades people are prosecuted in a criminal court
attributes.background: People save hard to have construction work done at there property, only to hire a trades person who stops work half way through a job leaving the home owner with an unfinished property and thousands of pounds out of pocket. This should be considered a criminal offence as county court is no deterrent
attributes.additional_details: Rogue trades people are often taken to county court by home owners when a trades person does not complete the work he/she has been contracted to complete. If the home owner wins the case the trades person will have a county court judgement which the home owner will then have to enforce if the trades person does not pay. This still does not guarantee that the home owner will receive any money. County court judgements are no deterrent to a trades person that has no assets that can be seized.

attributes.action: Make health warnings compulsory on processed meat.
attributes.background: Since the world health authority classified processed meat as class one carcinogen to humans. (Definitely causes cancer.) There should be health warnings placed on all packaging, in the same way the warnings have to be on cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: Class 1 carcinogen = definitely causes cancer in humans as classified by WHO.

attributes.action: Introduce Animal Health and Welfare to the school curriculum
attributes.background: Animal abuse cases have been on the rise, increasing by over 6,000 in 2014 and potentially more in 2015. Education could be a key factor to preventing the pattern from continuing into the future; reducing animal suffering and also giving future generations an understanding of animal care.
attributes.additional_details: The UK could be on the forefront of combating this through the introduction of a compulsory course that teaches students how to treat and perceive animals both wild and in our care. Education could take place both in and out of the classroom. Trips to sanctuaries, farms and zoos could be supplemented by an educational talk, allowing the students to see the animals first hand along side learning about their care and how to maintain their welfare.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Railway from increasing their 2017 ticket fares
attributes.background:
Southeaster railway continues to increase annual season ticket fares each year but never improve upon the service they offer. It was voted one of the worst ways to commute to London in 2016. 
Train fares have been reported to increase twice as fast as salaries in the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
We all pay thousands of pounds a year to travel into London or elsewhere via Southeastern railway and each year it gets more expensive and the service gets worse and worse with signalling problems, delayed trains, cancelled trains etc. 
It needs to stop so that everyone pays a FAIR amount for the poor service we are getting. I'm sure most would agree that we would be happy to pay the amount we are paying if the trains ran on time and without delays and if we all got a seat on our long commutes.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Allow cystic fibrosis patients decide when they are ready for a lung transplant
attributes.background: My brother in law needs a lung transplant as he suffers from cystic fibrosis, he has been in hospital for most of this year when he gets out he is back in within 12 days he is only 22 his lung function is around 30% and his consultant says he cant have a lung transplant yet should be his choice
attributes.additional_details: Every human being should have a good quality of life,  why should 1000s of people die every year not just with cystic fibrosis but everyone who needs an organ transplant? Most people die as a result of being placed on the transplant list to late, My brother in law who needs a lung transplant does not take life for granted he does not drink, smoke or take drugs he shows courage and determination all the time people like him are an inspiration for us all let it be his choice

attributes.action: School Summer holiday to be reduced and Easter holiday increased
attributes.background: Reduce 6-7 week holiday and increase Easter break, to allow more family's to take a holiday to hot continents, or visit relatives
attributes.additional_details: If summer holiday is reduced and Easter increased then an option to take a descent holiday is increased twice a year to travel to hot continents and less  absences during school time

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on London becoming independent from the UK
attributes.background:
London is the world's capital. 300+ languages are spoken here. Immigrants are welcome, and are vital to our economy.

We voted decisively to stay in the EU. Our global outlook sets us apart from the rest of England.

London's population is 8.5m – Scotland's is 5.3m.

Independence makes sense.
attributes.additional_details: Specifics: If you live within the M25, you get a vote – just like in the Scottish referendum. It doesn't matter if you're a British citizen or not. If you don't live within the M25, you don't get a vote.

attributes.action: Call a general election in the next 90 days as a result of the EU vote.
attributes.background: This vote should never have been called and as a result the population of the United Kingdom has no confidence in the leadership of the government. We demand a general election in the next 90 days to elect new leaders to help manage this emerging crisis.

attributes.action: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate students' mobile phones
attributes.background: Phones should not be confiscated because it is the students personal property. Schools have no technical right to be able to take their phones as they have no possession over the property.

attributes.action: Stop permission to build Branston Road School Academy on current proposed site
attributes.background: Vital arable land will be lost. Hedgerow vital to wildlife will be destroyed. Applicant, Planning Authority & Education Authority are one and the same! Surrounding villages were promised green barrier and then this was permitted! Villages not designed to cope with current traffic without school.
attributes.additional_details: Tatenhill Parish Councillors can be contacted for further info.  Burton Mail also has articles referencing objections.

attributes.action: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda
attributes.background: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda, publicly supporting ISIS or  getting people to join ISIS.

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Fully regulate Counselling and Psychotherapy, to properly protect the public.
attributes.background:
Anyone can call themselves "counsellor" or "psychotherapist", even with no qualifications at all.

Such people are a potentially fatal danger to clients, yet are currently free to practise.

There are societies to belong to, accreditations to gain and registers to join, but all are optional.
attributes.additional_details:
Successive governments have promised to regulate counselling for over a decade, but none have done so.

The "Accredited Register" scheme was created in 2013, and is like "CORGI" for counsellors. It sets minimum standards of training, insurance etc. However, you don't have to join a register and clients do not necessarily even know of its existence.

Regulation would protect the titles "counsellor" and "psychotherapist" and prevent those who do not meet minimum safety standards from practising.

attributes.action: Give Police a power to seize vehicles of those caught driving & using mobiles
attributes.background: Following the jailing today of Tomasz Kroker for 10 years for causing the deaths of Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith, it's time this country toughened the law on using a mobile phone behind the wheel.
attributes.additional_details: Most people don't even think about it.  They answer a call, they write or read a text whilst driving, they change music tracks like Tomasz Kroker as he drove a heavy goods vehicle.  Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith were on their way back from a holiday when they were killed instantly.  You have probably seen the moving video of their relatives describing the aftermath.  Sign this petition in their memory & for radical change.

attributes.action: Focus primary school education on social skills and creativity rather than exams
attributes.background: The current curriculum focuses on tests and results. It is putting unacceptable pressure on young children. Many parents simply want schooling in primary years to focus on social skills, creativity and fun What value is there in creating highly educated but traumatised children?
attributes.additional_details: Mental health issues are soaring in children. Childline has reported a marked increase. Children face many pressures, some of which simply didn't exist for older generations. Piling additional pressures on children through rigorous testing achieves nothing but anxiety for both child and parent.

attributes.action: Put a statue of Diane Abbott MP in the Palace of Westminster's Central Lobby.
attributes.background:
A full sized bronze statue should be commissioned and placed in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster to honour Diane Abbott MP.
As the first black woman to have a seat in the House of Commons and a faithful public servant she is an inspiration to us all; astonishingly resilient and brave.

attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. £1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Make train operators legally provide adjustments for passengers with autism.
attributes.background: People with autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) experience sensory difficulties. Train operators are failing to provide or enforce, quiet carriages, or other areas free of noise, distraction or bright lights. Passengers with hidden disabilities deserve adjustments too. We demand a statory requirement.
attributes.additional_details: Passengers with autism are being forced to sit on the carpet between carriages, challenge other passengers, to get distressed, go into meltdown or experience anxiety, simply because train operators won't cater for their needs. Complaints are dismissed and excuses such as availability, company policy are trotted out by train companies. The Equality Act is not being enforced for those with hidden disabilities and sensory impairments. We demand a new statutory duty for compliance and adjustments.

attributes.action: Cancel plans to open a trading office in Raleigh North Carolina
attributes.background: Recently North Carolina has passed a bill dubbed 'HB 2' which has "voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights". As a result many business ventures have removed or cancelled their investment plans in the state. The UK should also refuse to support a region that legalises LGBT discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: "North Carolina has lost a string of big investment ventures over Governor Pat McCrory’s decision to sign the contentious HB 2 – which voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights, banned transgender people from using their preferred bathroom, and permits businesses to discriminate against LGBT people on the grounds of religious belief" http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/07/26/uk-government-to-open-trade-hub-in-north-carolina-despite-controversy-over-anti-lgbt-law/

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship to all settled EU nationals in UK
attributes.background: Most EU nationals who are setteled in UK, made UK their home, have mortgages, pay taxes and their kids attend schools across Britain are feared that after UK left EU their right to live and work in UK will be ceased and this will have a detremental impact on their life!

attributes.action: Legalise civil partnerships for heterosexual couples
attributes.background: Everyone, whether heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual, should have the option of entering into either a marriage, or a civil partnership.

attributes.action: Stop the monitoring of benefits spending.
attributes.background: Benefit payments are a lifeline. These payments are funded by the public as an insurance against misfortune. The monitoring of these subsistence payments is a gross misuse of public money and an abuse of the public trust. People are entitled to spend their benefits as they choose.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.thecanary.co/2016/07/13/snooping-on-benefit-recipients-spending-and-is-totally-legal-with-this-phone-app/

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: Any new Prime Minister must have the confidence of the people and Parliament
attributes.background: We call for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act to be amended such that any new Prime Minister’s government must face an explicit vote of confidence in the Commons. If no government can win such a vote, a general election must be held.
attributes.additional_details:
After the EU Referendum result and the Prime Minister’s resignation, Parliament must show confidence in the Government or call a general election.

 The Government and any new Prime Minister have no mandate for post-referendum negotiations. The exceptional circumstances and political division require a new mandate.

 Petitions cannot call for a vote of No Confidence, nor for the dissolution of Parliament, but they can ask for an amendment to legislation such as the Fixed-term Parliaments Act.
